comments: a(0) could equally well be taken to be 1 rather than 2, which gives A007516. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 14 2009A subsequence of the Fermat numbers 2^2^n + 1 = A000215.a(0) through a(4) are primes; a(5) = 2^65536 + 1 is divisible by 825753601.
references: P. Ribenboim, The Book of Prime Number Records. Springer-Verlag, NY, 2nd ed., 1989, p. 73.
